alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 29 at 11:39AM EST until December 29 at 5:49PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. .Recent rainfall will lead to rising river levels across much of the region over the next 24-48 hrs. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Lowland agricultural flooding along CR 100 W just north of the river. High water affecting a small portion of River Road just east of SR 1 and north of the river. Water is within a few feet vertically of the approaches to SR 1 bridge in western Randolph county. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EST Wednesday was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 7.3 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 600 PM EST.
